instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2733: What is 820-2733? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Imac 27 2010 no USB
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2733</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

no USB


checked
5V into <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>

no output, no enable signal




<TRANSISTOR>Q4600</TRANSISTOR> getting 5V on pin 1



<RESISTOR>R4600</RESISTOR> ok 9.9ohm

should I replace <TRANSISTOR>Q4600</TRANSISTOR> or should I be looking somewhere else?

threads.title: Imac 27 2010 no USB
threads.message: Enable is supposed to be low. Did you check 5V on USB connectors?

threads.title: Imac 27 2010 no USB
threads.message: pin 1 on J4630? nothing on any of the pins

threads.title: Imac 27 2010 no USB
threads.message: Well, if <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>/01 pin 3 and 4 are low and 5V is coming in on pin 2 there should be output on pin 6. So looks like dead <CHIP>U4600</CHIP>/01, but I have never seen them both fail.
